p: FT-IR spectrum of carbohydrates could provide information on the structural features. The FT-IR spectrum of JC-PS1 is shown in Figure S1. The absorption bands at 3400 cm −1, 2930 cm −1, 1641 cm −1, 1040 cm −1 were characteristic absorption peaks of carbohydrates. The broad absorption peaks at 3400 cm −1 and 2930 cm −1 were attributed to the O-H stretching vibrations and C-H stretching vibrations, respectively [ 20]. The bands at 1641 cm −1 and 1425 cm −1 were due to the asymmetric and symmetric COO- stretching vibrations and assigned to the existence of uronic acid in JC-PS1 [ 21, 22], which was in accordance with the results of the monosaccharide composition analysis. The absorption bands at 1140 cm −1 and 1072 cm −1 indicated the existence of a pyranose configuration in JC-PS1 [ 23]. The absorption at 890 cm −1 indicated a β-configuration in JC-PS1 [ 24].
